topic: How to document microservices using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to document microservices using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Documenting Microservices Using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide covers the process of documenting microservices effectively using FastAPI, a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+.
key_points: FastAPI leverages type annotations and OpenAPI for automatic generation of API documentation
It supports multiple formats including JSON, XML, YAML, and Markdown
FastAPI offers easy-to-use routing, middleware, and request/response validation out of the box
The framework includes a built-in user interface for interactively testing APIs

code_examples.code:
openapi: 3.0.2
info:
  title: My API
  version: 1.0.0
paths:
  /items/{item_id}:
    get:
      summary: Read an item
      responses:
        200:
          description: OK
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                type: object
                properties:
                  item_id:
                    type: integer
                  q:
                    type: string

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required to utilize the latest features and improvements in FastAPI
FastAPI version 0.75.0 and above supports Python 3.12
caveats: Ensure proper installation of FastAPI before using the code examples
Some advanced features might not be compatible with all IDEs or text editors out-of-the-box, requiring plugins for optimal experience
